actions.args: {"body": {"name": "Redesign and UX improvents for Tresury Management System (15 Jul - 15 Aug )", "summary": "During the first month, I conducted a comprehensive review of all flows and interactions in the previous Treasury Management System. Based on stakeholder feedback and a UX audit, I redesigned the entire UI and improved the overall user experience. I also prepared development-ready assets and ensured they were properly maintained.", "category": "DevDAO Platform", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "supervisor": "theori.near", "description": "Hi, I\\\\\\'m Vova, a product designer with over a decade of experience and i help to make digital products useful, easy to use, also with consistency and scalable UI solutions.\\\\n\\\\nPreviously, in NEAR ecosystem i worked on *Race of Sloth*, and I\\\\u{2019}m currently focused on improving and launching the *Treasury Management System*.\\\\n\\\\n# Key Achievements:\\\\n\\\\n- **Navigation**: Simplified and improved navigation by removing excessive UI nesting for a more streamlined experience.\\\\n- **Table Component Redesign**: Reworked the table component with enhanced data cells.\\\\n    - Added column display settings.\\\\n    - Created a filter component.\\\\n    - Designed small interactions, such as hover states with detailed information.\\\\n    - Included additional, relevant data in tables.\\\\n- **Page and Flow Redesigns**: Redesigned improve and simplified those pages and flows:   \\\\n    - Dashboard\\\\n    - Payments Page / Create payment request flow / Voting flow\\\\n    - Stake Delegation Page / Create  Asset Exchange Flow\\\\n    - Asset Exchange / Create  Asset Exchange Flow\\\\n    - Settings / Members and Permissions\\\\n\\\\nAlso whole project was **prototyped** and you can try to interact with than by this [link](https://www.figma.com/proto/rJBIz8D62D3diyn7NeirQX/%F0%9F%8F%A6-Multisig-Treasury-Application-%E2%80%93%C2%A0Infrastructure-Committee?page-id=0%3A1&node-id=534-4696&node-type=frame&viewport=-19016%2C-1613%2C0.89&t=uA1dNmpTbHJ75I7y-1&scaling=min-zoom&content-scaling=fixed&starting-point-node-id=534%3A4696&show-proto-sidebar=1)\\\\n\\\\nThe primary goal of this first iteration was to create a more balanced visual hierarchy, making the system easier to navigate and information faster to scan.\\\\n\\\\n### Cost\\\\n- *Rate: $2500/month*\\\\n- *Total amount: $2500.00 USD*\\\\n", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "freski.near", "requested_sponsor": "neardevdao.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "2500", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDT"}, "labels": [], "accepted_terms_and_conditions_version": 128860384}

{"data": {"devhub.near": {"post": {"main": "{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"text\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"We have just received a new *DevDAO Platform* proposal.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**By**: @freski.near\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Title**: \\\\u{201c}Redesign and UX improvents for Tresury Management System (15 Jul - 15 Aug )\\\\u{201c}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Summary**:\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nDuring the first month, I conducted a comprehensive review of all flows and interactions in the previous Treasury Management System. Based on stakeholder feedback and a UX audit, I redesigned the entire UI and improved the overall user experience. I also prepared development-ready assets and ensured they were properly maintained.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\u{2014}\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nRead the full proposal and share your feedback on [DevHub](/devhub.near/widget/app?page=proposal&id=208)\\\\\\\"}"}, "index": {"post": "{\\\\\\\"key\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"main\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"value\\\\\\\":{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\"}}"}}}}

{"proposal": {"id": 208, "snapshot": {"name": "Redesign and UX improvents for Tresury Management System (15 Jul - 15 Aug )", "labels": [], "summary": "During the first month, I conducted a comprehensive review of all flows and interactions in the previous Treasury Management System. Based on stakeholder feedback and a UX audit, I redesigned the entire UI and improved the overall user experience. I also prepared development-ready assets and ensured they were properly maintained.", "category": "DevDAO Platform", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "editor_id": "freski.near", "timestamp": "1727265421865873611", "supervisor": "theori.near", "description": "Hi, I\\\\\\'m Vova, a product designer with over a decade of experience and i help to make digital products useful, easy to use, also with consistency and scalable UI solutions.\\\\n\\\\nPreviously, in NEAR ecosystem i worked on *Race of Sloth*, and I\\\\u{2019}m currently focused on improving and launching the *Treasury Management System*.\\\\n\\\\n# Key Achievements:\\\\n\\\\n- **Navigation**: Simplified and improved navigation by removing excessive UI nesting for a more streamlined experience.\\\\n- **Table Component Redesign**: Reworked the table component with enhanced data cells.\\\\n    - Added column display settings.\\\\n    - Created a filter component.\\\\n    - Designed small interactions, such as hover states with detailed information.\\\\n    - Included additional, relevant data in tables.\\\\n- **Page and Flow Redesigns**: Redesigned improve and simplified those pages and flows:   \\\\n    - Dashboard\\\\n    - Payments Page / Create payment request flow / Voting flow\\\\n    - Stake Delegation Page / Create  Asset Exchange Flow\\\\n    - Asset Exchange / Create  Asset Exchange Flow\\\\n    - Settings / Members and Permissions\\\\n\\\\nAlso whole project was **prototyped** and you can try to interact with than by this [link](https://www.figma.com/proto/rJBIz8D62D3diyn7NeirQX/%F0%9F%8F%A6-Multisig-Treasury-Application-%E2%80%93%C2%A0Infrastructure-Committee?page-id=0%3A1&node-id=534-4696&node-type=frame&viewport=-19016%2C-1613%2C0.89&t=uA1dNmpTbHJ75I7y-1&scaling=min-zoom&content-scaling=fixed&starting-point-node-id=534%3A4696&show-proto-sidebar=1)\\\\n\\\\nThe primary goal of this first iteration was to create a more balanced visual hierarchy, making the system easier to navigate and information faster to scan.\\\\n\\\\n### Cost\\\\n- *Rate: $2500/month*\\\\n- *Total amount: $2500.00 USD*\\\\n", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "freski.near", "requested_sponsor": "neardevdao.near", "proposal_body_version": "V0", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "2500", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDT"}, "author_id": "freski.near", "snapshot_history": [], "social_db_post_block_height": "0"}}

{"handle": "hacks", "community": {"tag": "hacks", "name": "DevHub Hacks", "addons": [{"id": "announcements", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "announcements", "parameters": "{}", "display_name": "Announcements"}, {"id": "discussions", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "discussions", "parameters": "{}", "display_name": "Discussions"}, {"id": "activity", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "activity", "parameters": "{}", "display_name": "Activity"}, {"id": "5c99bm", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "wiki", "parameters": "{\\\\\\\"title\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"Overview\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"subtitle\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"content\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"GM fam! This community is all about hackathons. We\\\\u{2019}re here to build beyond the hype, crypto winter, pandemic, and war. We\\\\u{2019}re here to hack this world to perfection, or, at least, to being a better place through the power of BOS and blockchain technology.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## Our groups\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nThe Hacks community consists of two main groups: \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### Working group\\\\\\\\nThis formal group is a selected committee of subject matter experts who make official decisions on proposals and questions related to Hackathons and technical events on NEAR. They follow a strict process to review proposals, recommend funding to DAO, and hold grant takers accountable. They also engage with the broader community to understand their needs and encourage ideation. \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Members**\\\\\\\\n- Maria Yarotska @yarotska.near\\\\\\\\n- Vlad Frolov @frol.near\\\\\\\\n- Nneoma Kanu @nneoma.near\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n### Community Group\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nThis informal self-organized group provides a space to discuss and implement ideas around developer focused events in and beyond the Near ecosystem. While this group does not make official decisions, it offers a great opportunity to meet with others to share ideas and submit proposals. This group is not controlled by anyone but the people who are organizing it. The group has a dedicated Telegram channel as well as regular Twitter spaces. \\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Communication Channels**\\\\\\\\n- [DevHub Hacks Community Group in Telegram](https://t.me/+Pdipk3olNgw3NWMy)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n## How to get involved\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n- Join the community group\\\\\\'s dedicated [Telegram group](https://t.me/+Pdipk3olNgw3NWMy) to learn about the latest discussions and activities. Don\\\\u{2019}t forget to introduce yourself.\\\\\\\\n- Subscribe to DevHub\\\\u{2019}s [Twitter account](https://twitter.com/NEARDevHub) to make sure you don\\\\u{2019}t miss our monthly Spaces hangout.\\\\\\\\n- Participate in discussions, comment on existing ideas, or propose new ideas.\\\\\\\\n- Volunteer to speak about a topic or be a co-host for a Twitter Space.\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"textAlign\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"left\\\\\\\"}", "display_name": "About"}, {"id": "s46evi", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "wiki", "parameters": "{\\\\\\\"title\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"Projects\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"subtitle\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"content\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"If you have a hackathon-related project building on NEAR and would like it featured here or have an update for a featured project, please fill out this [Google form](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSc2XZcfkVJmSCqZDveVjpOOa-n8JAi2Cv4DLnlMy5taJXLaYg/viewform).\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"textAlign\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"left\\\\\\\"}", "display_name": "Projects"}, {"id": "iqll86", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "wiki", "parameters": "{\\\\\\\"title\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"How to request support\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"content\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"We are always on the lookout for events that align with our mission and provide value to the NEAR ecosystem. If you are organizing such an event, we would love to hear from you! Below is a guide on how to submit a sponsorship proposal to us.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**Pre-Approval Criteria:**\\\\\\\\nYour proposal should address the following key areas that we use to evaluate event sponsorships:\\\\\\\\n1. Event Information: \\\\\\\\nProvide details about the event. This should include the scope, budget, target audience, goals, and expected outcomes of the event. (Refer to the template below)\\\\\\\\n2. Host Background: \\\\\\\\nTell us about your experience hosting similar events. Include past successes, what you\\\\\\'ve learned, and how you\\\\\\'ve grown your event-hosting skills.\\\\\\\\n3. Dev/Project Potential Stickiness: \\\\\\\\nExplain the relevance of the event to NEAR. Describe how the event will promote NEAR and foster growth in the NEAR ecosystem.\\\\\\\\n4. Post Execution Metrics: \\\\\\\\nAfter the event, we will be looking at these metrics to evaluate further possible collaboration:\\\\\\\\n5. Onboarded developers\\\\\\\\nProjects built on NEAR testnet/mainnet\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**How to Submit Your Proposal:**\\\\\\\\n- Go to the DevHub board.\\\\\\\\n- Click the \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"Submit Idea/Solution\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\" button.\\\\\\\\n- Create a new post using the template provided below and post it as an Idea.\\\\\\\\n- Allow us some time to assess and evaluate your proposal.\\\\\\\\n- Upon approval, receive an attestation of sponsorship.\\\\\\\\n- Congratulations! You\\\\\\'ve secured your sponsorship!\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**PROPOSAL TEMPLATE**\\\\\\\\nUse this template to structure your proposal. Make sure to provide detailed responses to each point.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n**[Your Organization] [Event Name] Proposal**\\\\\\\\n1. Event Introduction\\\\\\\\nProvide a brief explanation of your event, its overall goals, and its target audience.\\\\\\\\nExample: \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"[Event Name] is a large festival designed for [target audience]. Our main goal is to promote [specific concepts or technology] among [target audience].\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"\\\\\\\\n2. Organizer Introduction\\\\\\\\nDescribe who you are, any relevant credentials you have, and why you\\\\\\'re the right person/team to organize this event.\\\\\\\\nExample: \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"[Your Organization] is the regional hub for everyone interested in [specific activity or field]. We have organized numerous programs and events that have helped [target audience] to [specific outcomes].\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"\\\\\\\\n3. Event Impact\\\\\\\\nDescribe the expected outcome of the event, its significance in a broader context, and how it will further the goals of the field or community you\\\\\\'re working with.\\\\\\\\nExample: \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"The [Event Name] will strengthen [Organization\\\\\\'s or Field\\\\\\'s Impact] in [region], and promote [specific concept or technology] to developers, builders, and creators in the region.\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"\\\\\\\\n4. Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)\\\\\\\\nProvide the expected metrics the event aims to achieve, such as the number of attendees, number of projects developed, and so on.\\\\\\\\nExample: \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"We expect to attract over [number] developers, with [number] hackathon participants, and at least [number] projects. The event will feature [number] prizes across [number] categories.\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"\\\\\\\\n5. Evaluation Factors\\\\\\\\nProvide the criteria for judging the event\\\\\\'s success, especially if it\\\\\\'s a competition.\\\\\\\\nExample: \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"Projects will be evaluated based on team composition, market potential, product innovation, business model, and growth strategy.\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"\\\\\\\\n6. Funding Request\\\\\\\\nProvide a detailed breakdown of the requested funding, showing exactly how the funds will be allocated.\\\\\\\\nExample: \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"We are requesting [$amount] for [specific allocation of funds].\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"\\\\\\\\n7. Additional Information\\\\\\\\nInclude any further details, related links, or relevant attachments to support the proposal.\\\\\\\\nExample: \\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"[Link to additional resources]\\\\\\\\\\\\\\\"\\\\\\\"}", "display_name": "Get Support"}, {"id": "bi1ycv", "enabled": true, "addon_id": "telegram", "parameters": "{\\\\\\\"handles\\\\\\\":[\\\\\\\"neardevhubhacks\\\\\\\"]}", "display_name": "Telegram"}], "admins": ["yarotska.near", "frol.near", "nneoma.near"], "handle": "hacks", "logo_url": "https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreiamrrlcm45b3ypk5afvqds7bqbyei3d7a2ttinnjwzbykhlavfbvy", "banner_url": "https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreihnj2nk5lxsvu3x7vge2yrbiynvagxre5thqvhsirner5rocmdkam", "description": "Hackathons and meetups for Nearians around the world", "website_url": "near.org/hackbox.near/widget/home", "bio_markdown": "A hub dedicated to hosting and supporting developer focused events for the global community of Near enthusiasts. Test", "github_handle": null, "twitter_handle": null, "telegram_handle": "https://t.me/neardevhubhacks"}}

Test\\\\n\\\\nLearn more about our community [on DevHub](/devhub.near/widget/app?page=community&handle=hacks).", "backgroundImage": {"url": "https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreihnj2nk5lxsvu3x7vge2yrbiynvagxre5thqvhsirner5rocmdkam"}}}, "discussions.hacks.community.devhub.near": {"profile": {"name": "DevHub Hacks (Community Discussions)", "tags": {"hacks": "", "community": "", "discussions": ""}, "image": {"url": "https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreiamrrlcm45b3ypk5afvqds7bqbyei3d7a2ttinnjwzbykhlavfbvy"}, "linktree": {"github": null, "twitter": null, "website": "near.social/devhub.near/widget/app?page=community&handle=hacks", "telegram": "https://t.me/neardevhubhacks"}, "description": "Hackathons and meetups for Nearians around the world\\\\n\\\\nLearn more about our community [on DevHub](/devhub.near/widget/app?page=community&handle=hacks).", "backgroundImage": {"url": "https://ipfs.near.social/ipfs/bafkreihnj2nk5lxsvu3x7vge2yrbiynvagxre5thqvhsirner5rocmdkam"}}}}}

{"data": {"post": {"main": "{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"text\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"**REDACTED Travel Stipend Announcement**\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nHey hackers! \\\\\\\\nYou asked, and we delivered. Following up on multiple discussions in our community channels,  here are your guidelines regarding the travel stipend for the hackers participating in the IRL REDACTED movement in Bangkok, Thailand.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nNEAR DevHub is offering $20k in travel stipends to make sure our hackers can get some of their travel expenses covered. We\\\\u{2019}re issuing one-time travel grants to registered hackers who show up in person and successfully submit a project that meets our submission criteria:\\\\\\\\n*Up to $250 to those traveling from cities within Thailand (other than Bangkok)\\\\\\\\n*Up to $500 to those traveling from Southeast Asia countries\\\\\\\\n*Up to $1000 to those traveling from overseas (US, Canada, LATAM, Africa and any other country not on our [sanctioned list](https://redacted.devpost.com/rules)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nTo be eligible for this stipend, you have to be an **experienced NEAR hacker** and have a **proven track record** to include into your stipend application:\\\\\\\\n*A link to your project(s) submitted to one of the previous NEAR hackathons including but not limited to NEARCON IRL Hackathon, MetaBUILD etc.\\\\\\\\n*A link to your ETHGlobal hackathon project(s) (any edition)\\\\\\\\n*A link to your project submitted to any of the hackathons NEAR sponsored in the last 2 years.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nHere\\\\u{2019}s how to get your travel stipend in 5 easy steps:\\\\\\\\n1. Post a public proposal to the [Events Committee proposal board](https://near.social/events-committee.near/widget/app?page=home) (be sure to include your track record and travel itinerary) by November 1st, 2024\\\\\\\\n2. Receive an attestation from one or more of NEAR DevHub core contributors\\\\\\\\n3. Submit an eligible project and update your proposal with a [Devpost](https://redacted.devpost.com/) submission page URL\\\\\\\\n4. Show up at REDACTED in person\\\\\\\\n5. Get your stipend!\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nOne hacking team can apply for multiple stipends. The stipends are capped at a total of $20k and are issued on the first-come, first-served basis. The stipends will be issued throughout 60 days after the hackathon results are announced.\\\\\\\\nPlease let us know if you have any questions in the comments section and feel free to reach out to us in the [official REDACTED group](https://t.me/redactedbangkok) on Telegram!\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\"}"}, "index": {"post": "{\\\\\\\"key\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"main\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"value\\\\\\\":{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\"}}"}}, "handle": "hacks"}

{"data": {"hacks.community.devhub.near": {"post": {"main": "{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"text\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"**REDACTED Travel Stipend Announcement**\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nHey hackers! \\\\\\\\nYou asked, and we delivered. Following up on multiple discussions in our community channels,  here are your guidelines regarding the travel stipend for the hackers participating in the IRL REDACTED movement in Bangkok, Thailand.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nNEAR DevHub is offering $20k in travel stipends to make sure our hackers can get some of their travel expenses covered. We\\\\u{2019}re issuing one-time travel grants to registered hackers who show up in person and successfully submit a project that meets our submission criteria:\\\\\\\\n*Up to $250 to those traveling from cities within Thailand (other than Bangkok)\\\\\\\\n*Up to $500 to those traveling from Southeast Asia countries\\\\\\\\n*Up to $1000 to those traveling from overseas (US, Canada, LATAM, Africa and any other country not on our [sanctioned list](https://redacted.devpost.com/rules)\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nTo be eligible for this stipend, you have to be an **experienced NEAR hacker** and have a **proven track record** to include into your stipend application:\\\\\\\\n*A link to your project(s) submitted to one of the previous NEAR hackathons including but not limited to NEARCON IRL Hackathon, MetaBUILD etc.\\\\\\\\n*A link to your ETHGlobal hackathon project(s) (any edition)\\\\\\\\n*A link to your project submitted to any of the hackathons NEAR sponsored in the last 2 years.\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nHere\\\\u{2019}s how to get your travel stipend in 5 easy steps:\\\\\\\\n1. Post a public proposal to the [Events Committee proposal board](https://near.social/events-committee.near/widget/app?page=home) (be sure to include your track record and travel itinerary) by November 1st, 2024\\\\\\\\n2. Receive an attestation from one or more of NEAR DevHub core contributors\\\\\\\\n3. Submit an eligible project and update your proposal with a [Devpost](https://redacted.devpost.com/) submission page URL\\\\\\\\n4. Show up at REDACTED in person\\\\\\\\n5. Get your stipend!\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\nOne hacking team can apply for multiple stipends. The stipends are capped at a total of $20k and are issued on the first-come, first-served basis. The stipends will be issued throughout 60 days after the hackathon results are announced.\\\\\\\\nPlease let us know if you have any questions in the comments section and feel free to reach out to us in the [official REDACTED group](https://t.me/redactedbangkok) on Telegram!\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\\n\\\\\\\"}"}, "index": {"post": "{\\\\\\\"key\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"main\\\\\\\",\\\\\\\"value\\\\\\\":{\\\\\\\"type\\\\\\\":\\\\\\\"md\\\\\\\"}}"}}}}
